metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23219 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
The deprecated compatibility function clnt_create in the sunrpc module of the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34 copies its hostname argument on the stack without validating its length, which may result in a buffer overflow, potentially resulting in a denial of service or (if an application is not built with a stack protector enabled) arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-23219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
libc-bin - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
libc6 - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
libc6-amd64 - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
libc6-i386 - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
libc6-prof - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
libc6-s390 - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
libc6-x32 - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
locales - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
locales-all - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
nscd - 2.34-0ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Ubuntu has stack protector enabled since 2006, so this issue is only a denial of service.

criterions.comment: glibc package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34-0ubuntu3.2').
